label: 別当
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: A Buddhist official in charge of a Buddhist temple, being the representative of the central government at such an institution. Such officials were placed at the Yakushi-ji in Shimotsuke-no-kuni, the Tō-ji, Tōdai-ji, Kōfuku-ji, Shitennō-ji, Onjō-ji, Kiyomizu-dera, etc. An official at the head of some governmental body or bffice, or at the head of the family officials of an important family. Head official of the Office of the Imperial Police (Kebiishichō), and of various other governmental organs.
